description: Tennessine is a synthetic halogen named after the state of Tennessee. It is expected to share some behavior with astatine, though relativistic effects may soften its reactivity compared to lighter halogens. Only a few atoms have ever been synthesized, each decaying within fractions of a second. Tennessine provides insight into heavy p-block chemistry and pushes the boundaries of experimental nuclear science. It remains important for understanding how far halogen-like behavior extends in the superheavy region.
name: Tennessine
